ski_touring_system: Climbing skins (fitted, glue in good condition)
pack_carry: Dry-bag or pack liner (for storms/wet snow)
navigation_communication: Offline maps on phone or GPS device
technical_optional_by_terrain: Ice axe (if steep/firm or exposed terrain possible)
emergency_repair: Repair kit (multitool, ski straps, duct tape, binding/boot spares as needed)

rules: A wind-stopping outer layer is ALWAYS included (at minimum a windproof shell; often a hardshell).
Adjust layers dynamically with effort: start cool, vent early, add insulation for stops.
Carry at least one dry spare for hands and one extra insulation piece for unexpected delays.

windstopper_outer_layer: Windproof shell jacket (windstopper) OR waterproof hardshell jacket (windproof by default)
legs: Windproof overpant or hardshell pant (carried when conditions demand)

outer_layers.required_windstopper: Windproof hardshell jacket (preferred) or windproof shell jacket
outer_layers.legs: Windproof hardshell pants or windproof overpant

accessories.hands: Mittens preferred + liners; spare dry pair mandatory
accessories.notes: Frostbite risk: cover all skin; limit long stops; keep insulation accessible.

outer_layers.required_windstopper: Windproof shell jacket OR hardshell jacket
outer_layers.legs: Windproof pant (softshell OK if truly windproof) + carry hardshell if snow is heavy/wet

accessories.head_face: Buff + thin beanie; goggles if wind/snow
accessories.notes: Start slightly cool; vent early to prevent sweat freezing later.

base_layer.legs: Light to medium bottoms (optional depending on effort)

mid_layers.static_extra: Packable puffy optional but recommended for long breaks

outer_layers.required_windstopper: Windproof shell jacket ALWAYS (carried; often worn on ridge/descent)
outer_layers.legs: Wind-resistant touring pants; carry hardshell pants if precipitation is expected

accessories.head_face: Thin beanie/headband + buff; goggles if snow/wind
accessories.notes: Typical touring zone: skin in breathable layers, add windstopper for transitions and descents.

base_layer.legs: Often none; or thin tights if you run cold

mid_layers.static_extra: Light puffy recommended if remote/long tour

outer_layers.required_windstopper: Windproof shell jacket ALWAYS (carried; worn when exposed or descending)
outer_layers.legs: Breathable touring pants; carry rain-capable hardshell if wet precip possible

accessories.hands: Liner gloves often enough on ascent; insulated pair for descent
accessories.head_face: Sun hat/helmet + sunglasses; goggles packed if snow possible
accessories.notes: Overheating common: prioritize venting; wind can chill quickly when you stop.

base_layer.torso: Very light base (or short sleeve) + sun protection
base_layer.legs: Light touring pants/shorts depending on environment and policy

mid_layers.static_extra: Thin emergency insulation recommended in pack

outer_layers.required_windstopper: Packable windproof shell jacket ALWAYS (mandatory even in warm weather)
outer_layers.legs: Light wind-resistant pants; optional hardshell if rain likely

accessories.hands: Thin gloves optional; keep a warmer pair for high ridges/descents
accessories.notes: Dehydration and sun exposure become primary risks; windstopper still vital for exposed descents.

none_or_dry_snow.jacket_choice: Windproof shell jacket can be sufficient if no wet precipitation; hardshell still preferred for storms/exposure.
none_or_dry_snow.pants_choice: Windproof touring pants; add overpant only if needed.

heavy_snow.notes: Snow loading + moisture management: keep insulation dry; use vents.

required_additions: Pack liner or dry-bags for insulation
wet_snow_or_rain.notes: Highest hypothermia risk; avoid long exposed stops; keep one insulation piece protected and dry.
